skills.title: Front-End
skills.description: Crafting engaging user experiences with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Proficient in design tools like Canva, Figma and Adobe XD, I bring a keen eye for user interface aesthetics. My projects often involve frameworks such as jQuery and Bootstrap, creating visually appealing and responsive web applications. Additionally, I leverage my skills in Canva for dynamic content creation, enhancing the visual aspects of social media platforms.

skills.title: Back-End
skills.description: I excel in languages like Java and C#, developing robust systems and ensuring seamless functionality. Frameworks such as ASP .NET and my expertise in databases, including MySQL, MongoDB and Firebase Database contribute to the foundation of scalable and efficient applications. Git, Visual Studio, Azure, and Jira are integral parts of my development toolkit, facilitating collaborative and streamlined project management processes.

skills.title: Social Media Management
skills.description: My role at The Wild Bird Store showcases strategic collaboration. I align social media and web strategies with business goals, ensuring a cohesive online presence. Dynamic content creation using Canva enhances engagement on platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. I lead responsive redesign projects on WordPress, integrating plugins for optimal functionality, and analyze metrics for informed data-driven decision-making.

skills.title: Soft Skills
skills.description: With over seven years in customer service, predominantly in the hospitality sector, I've developed exceptional time management and problem-solving abilities. Effective oral and written communication skills enable me to convey complex technical concepts and collaborate seamlessly within a team. My holistic approach to projects encompasses not only technical proficiency but also strategic collaboration, data-driven decision-making, and an emphasis on user experience.

portfolio.title: BiteByte Point-of-Sale System
portfolio.description: Collaborated on a team project from August to December 2023 to develop a small-scale Point-Of-Sales (POS) System. Key contributions include designing and implementing a secure database system, creating a functional backend using C# .NET, and ensuring thorough testing of all functionalities. The system prioritized basic features, high maintainability, and a user-friendly interface. Technical proficiencies encompassed UI design in Figma, development using Visual Studio 2022, MySQL Workbench, and VMWare. Web development skills involved C# .NET, WPF, and Typescript, supported by various frameworks and dependencies for a comprehensive POS solution.

portfolio.title: Soffit Hanger Website
portfolio.description: I spearheaded the redesign of the Soffit Hanger website, prioritizing enhanced accessibility and ensuring seamless responsiveness across devices. The overhaul involved meticulous attention to detail, focusing on the use of precise language to improve user comprehension. By carefully selecting words that resonate with the target audience, the website now offers a more user-friendly experience, making it easier for visitors to understand the product offerings. Additionally, the redesign optimizes visibility for all products, creating an intuitive browsing experience that aligns with modern design standards.

portfolio.title: Lush Lash Website
portfolio.description: I initiated the development of the LushLash website for a client seeking a user-friendly platform that she could effortlessly maintain. In crafting the foundational structure, I designed a website that empowers the client with the flexibility to make updates effortlessly. From simple changes in color schemes, styles, and images to real-time updates in product prices, the website is tailored to provide a seamless and intuitive experience for ongoing maintenance. By prioritizing ease of use, I ensured that my client not only received a customized and visually appealing website initially but also possesses the autonomy to adapt and refine it according to evolving needs.
